sentence.Network_en: Listening to customers is now part of the mantra of new management in public services.
sentence.Network_cn: 倾听顾客意见现在已成了公共事业机构每一届新管理层都会奉行的准则之一。

sentence.Network_en: The next few weeks will determine whether this mantra means anything.
sentence.Network_cn: 接下来的几周将决定这种愿望是否能够达成.

sentence.Network_en: The thought pattern created by mantra are positive, beneficial, calming ones.
sentence.Network_cn: 吟诵真言可以促使我们形成积极 、 有益 、 平和的思维方式.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: Sanskrit, literally instrument of thought', from man 'think'

entry.tran: (佛教和印度教中的)曼特罗，祷文，符咒
entry.def: A mantra is a word or phrase repeated by Buddhists and Hindus when they meditate, or to help them feel calm.

entry.tran: （尤指认为并不正确或只是部分正确的）准则，原则，圭臬
entry.def: You can use mantra to refer to a statement or a principle that people repeat very often because they think it is true, especially when you think that it not true or is only part of the truth.

example.ex: Listening to customers is now part of the mantra of new management in public services.
example.tran: 倾听顾客意见现在已成了公共事业机构每一届新管理层都会奉行的准则之一。

means.word_mean: 1. a commonly repeated word or phrase;

sentences.sentence: "she repeated `So pleased with how its going' at intervals like a mantra"

means.word_mean: 2. (Sanskrit) literally a `sacred utterance' in Vedism; one of a collection of orally transmitted poetic hymns
